title: Strong housing market set to deliver record year for builder Galliford Try

Wed, Jul 8, 2015, 09:45 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 45 mins Strong housing market set to deliver record year for builder Galliford Try By Jon Yeomans | Telegraph – 46 minutes ago 9.38 -0.95 
Pre (Shanghai: 600048.SS - news ) -tax profit will be at the upper end of estimates, the housebuilder says 
A strong UK housing market is set to carry Galliford Try (LSE: GFRD.L - news ) to record full-year results , the builder said today. 
Pre-tax profit for the year to June 30, 2015 will be at the upper end of analyst estimates of £105.9m to £113.0m, the company said, as it was buoyed by “encouraging market trends” and renewed confidence following the Conservative election victory in May . 
The housebuilder completed on 3,177 units, compared with 3,107 units the year before, while the average sale price of a house in its Linden Homes division rose 7pc to £327,000. 
“It has been another record year for Galliford Try, and we are pleased to see that the momentum across the group continues ,” said Greg Fitzgerald, executive chairman. 
Galliford Try’s construction division reported growth in revenue and profits 
“We are also delighted with the two important acquisitions of Miller Construction and Shepherd Homes, further increasing the group's opportunities and capacity. Labour availability and cost remain challenging but we continue to manage this effectively, working closely with our supply chain.” 
The company now has a record total landbank of 15,750 plots, up 13pc on 2014, while Linden Homes has all of its plots secured for the new financial year and 87pc secured for the year after that. 
“Housing market conditions remain positive and the directors take further confidence from the significant increase in the group's landbank,” added Mr Fitzgerald. 
“Following a resilient performance in construction throughout a tough recession, we are pleased to report another profitable year for the division, and are encouraged by the outlook, with opportunities growing across multiple sectors.” 
Galliford Try’s construction division reported growth in revenue and profits, while the order book more than doubled to £3.5bn, following its £16.6m acquisition of Miller Construction. 
Galliford Try also trades under the Morrison Construction and Pentland brands. 
Mr Fitzgerald is due to retire from the FTSE 250 business later this year, after serving 33 years at the helm. 
The housebuilder will report its full-year results on September 16.
